movies.title: My Führer
movies.originalTitle: Mein Führer - Die wirklich wahrste Wahrheit über Adolf Hitler
movies.plot: The action comedy is set in 1944. Hitler appears in it as physically and mentally destroyed person who takes the advice of Goebbels in the actor-teacher of Jewish concentration camp for lessons eloquence to inspire the German people to further fight.
movies.simplePlot: The action comedy is set in 1944. Hitler appears in it as physically and mentally destroyed person who takes the advice of Goebbels in the actor-teacher of Jewish concentration camp for ...

biography.bio: Helge Schneider was born on August 30, 1955 in Mülheim an der Ruhr, Germany. He is an actor, known for 00 Schneider - Im Wendekreis der Eidechse (2013), Mülheim - Texas: Helge Schneider hier und dort (2015) and Helge - Komm hier haste ne Mark! Helge und Band live in Berlin (2011).
biography.name: Helge Schneider

biography.bio: Ulrich Mühe was born on June 20, 1953 in Grimma, East Germany as Friedrich Hans Ulrich Mühe. He was an actor and director, known for The Lives of Others (2006), Le dernier témoin (1998) and Funny Games (1997). He was married to Susanne Lothar, Jenny Gröllmann and Annegret Hahn. He died on July 22, 2007 in Walbeck, Saxony-Anhalt, Germany.
biography.name: Ulrich Mühe

biography.bio: Sylvester Groth was born on March 31, 1958 in Jerichow, East Germany. He is an actor, known for Inglourious Basterds (2009), The Man from U.N.C.L.E. (2015) and The Reader (2008).
biography.name: Sylvester Groth

biography.bio: Adriana Altaras was born in Zagreb (Croatia) and grew up in Italy and Germany. After graduating from High School she studied at Berlin's Academy of Dramatic Arts. She completed her studies at the New York University. Adriana Altaras is co-founder of Berlin's most important off-theater, the Theater zum West lichen Stadthirschen, where she worked as actress, director, and author for several years. Her performances include 'Der Frosch' (Achternbusch), 'Die Nächte der Cabiria' (after Fellini), 'Clara S.' (Jelinek), 'Sommernachtstraum' (Shakespeare), the original performance of Matthias Zschokke's 'Elefanten können nicht' and the first German performance of Leona Carrington's 'Penelope'. Further, Ms. Altaras played at the Maxim-Gorki-Theater and the Freie Volksbühne in Berlin, and at the city theaters in Basel, Constance, and Stuttgart. She wrote a solo piece, 'Jonteff', that she performed in Germany, Austria, Hungary, and Brazil. Adriana Altaras has directed plays at the College of Hearts in Berlin ('Der letzte Waschgang'), at Berlin's Academy of Dramatic Arts ('Schlag nach bei Shakespeare'), at the Landestheater Neustrelitz ('Marry Me a Little'), the Berliner Ensemble ('Was gibts Neues vom Krieg', original performance), the Theater tri-Bühne in Stuttgart ('Die Hose'), and several times at the Neuköllner Oper in Berlin ('Frau Parker kann nicht schlafen, Liebestrank'), were she last staged the operas 'La sorella amante' and 'Tom Jones'. Ms. Altaras' current mise en scène is a German version of the 'Vagina Monologues'. Released in summer 2001, the production is currently being resumed due to its big success. In 2002 she directed a production of 'Women' at Berlin's Gorki Theater, Her latest work as a director is 'Hyp 'OP', scenes about and with the participation of hyperactive children. Besides working on and for the stage, Adriana Altaras frequently appears in TV and cinema films. These include 'Dorado One Way', 'Der Philosoph', 'Sieben Frauen', 'Das Kondom des Grauens', 'Love Is Around', 'Liebling Kreuzberg, 'Siebenstein', 'Top Cops', 'Cornelius hilft', 'Wolffs Revier', 'Tatort, 'Schimanski', 'Das 'Gesetz der Serie', 'Apocalypso', 'Happy Birthday', 'Paradiso', 'Kalt ist der Abendhauch', 'Rot und Blau', 'Der Puppengräber', 'Geschlecht weiblich', 'Alles auf Zucker', 'Mein Führer', 'Schliemann und Sophia', 'Prinz Edouard', 'Max Minsky und ich' and 'Der Vollidiot'. Moreover, Ms. Altaras teaches Musical at Berlin's Academy of Arts, and works as an interviewer for the Shoa Foundation. In 1988 Ms. Altaras was awarded with the German Film Award, and she received the Theater Award of Northrhine-Westfalia in 1993. She belonged to the ensemble awarded with the Actors Award (Silver Bear) of Berlin's Film Festival for Rudolf Thome's "Paradiso" in 2000.
biography.name: Adriana Altaras

biography.bio: Stefan Kurt was born on October 22, 1959 in Berne, Switzerland. He is an actor and producer, known for Quatre minutes (2006), L'enfance volée (2011) and Gegen Ende der Nacht (1998).
biography.name: Stefan Kurt

biography.bio: Ulrich Noethen was born on November 18, 1959 in Munich, Germany as Ulrich Schmidt. He is an actor, known for Downfall (2004), The Harmonists (1997) and The Flying Classroom (2003). He was previously married to Friederike Wagner.
biography.name: Ulrich Noethen

biography.bio: Lambert Hamel was born on June 7, 1940 in Ludwigshafen, Germany. He is known for his work on My Führer (2007), Martin Luther (1983) and Happy Birthday, Türke! (1992).
biography.name: Lambert Hamel

biography.bio: Udo Kroschwald was born in 1955 in Freiberg, German Democratic Republic. He is an actor, known for SOKO Wismar (2004), The Pianist (2002) and The Monuments Men (2014).
biography.name: Udo Kroschwald

biography.bio: Torsten Michaelis was born on January 31, 1961 in Berlin, German Democratic Republic. He is an actor, known for The Reader (2008), Unknown (2011) and Toyland (2007).
biography.name: Torsten Michaelis

biography.bio: Axel Werner was born in 1945. He is an actor, known for Go for Zucker (2004), My Führer (2007) and Das Land hinter dem Regenbogen (1992). He is married to Ulrike Krumbiegel.
biography.name: Axel Werner

biography.bio: Victor Schefé was born on August 4, 1968 in Rostock, German Democratic Republic. He is an actor and director, known for Spectre (2015), Bridge of Spies (2015) and Bewegte Männer (2003).
biography.name: Victor Schefé

biography.bio: Lars Rudolph was born on August 18, 1966 in Wittmund, Lower Saxony, Germany. He is an actor, known for Run Lola Run (1998), Les Harmonies Werckmeister (2000) and The Princess and the Warrior (2000).
biography.name: Lars Rudolph

biography.bio: Director. Cinematographer. Writer. Studied germanistics, history and americanistics in film, Berlin, Germany. Studied at the Deutsche Film- und Fernsehakademie (DFFB) in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Wolfgang Becker

biography.bio: Bernd Stegemann was born on January 9, 1949 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for The Baader Meinhof Complex (2008), Effets secondaires (2007) and Go for Zucker (2004). He has been married to Renate Krößner since August 28, 2005.
biography.name: Bernd Stegemann

biography.bio: Shawn Karlborg was born in 1989. He is an actor, known for My Führer (2007), 1:0 für das Glück (2008) and Der Zimmerspringbrunnen (2001).
biography.name: Shawn Karlborg

categories.category: Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role (Beste darstellerische Leistung - Männliche Nebenrolle)
